frameDefinitions: An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue.
A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works.
A Communicator or Medium briefly references something in a Message, in which only a subpart of the full content is profiled.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) have an agreement.
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
frameExamples: Jason <t>completed</t> grading the papers late Sunday night.
Sun has (hopefully) already <t>tested</t> it for compliance.
The General Secretary <t>mentions</t> some of them in his report.
The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> to share early warning data on missile launches.
I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Agent</fen> who has finished an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> has finished.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> finishes.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> finishes the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The person who uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
The entity that the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Product</fen>.
An action that the <fen>Tester</fen> intends to accomplish subjecting the <fen>Product</fen> to a test of its functioning.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Tester</fen> hopes to find to obtain when using the <fen>Product</fen>.
A variable of behavior of the <fen>Product</fen> which is specifically evaluated.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to evaluate its functioning.
The location in which the test is carried out.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The relevant entity or state-of-affairs that the <fen>Communicator</fen> mentions.
When the the <fen>Message</fen> is mentioned.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates the <fen>Message</fen>.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: I just wish <fex>we</fex> could have tested the car with a manual gearbox, instead of the five-speed automatic
To ensure that the remedy is complete, nCipher have fully reviewed the software and tested it <fex>for similar errors</fex>.
Once you have copied your site and have tested it <fex>to make sure it works normally</fex>, you're ready to pull out the scalpel and start hacking away.
Test-Driven Development requires you to set an expectation of a result and then test <fex>that the result is achieved</fex>.
ILCSO staff have tested <fex>the behavior of the ILCSO-standard version of WebVoyage with several browsers</fex>.
We tested the product <fex>in California</fex> first.
<fex>Her father</fex> never mentioned it.
A CBS report did mention <fex>that the First Lady was required to wear a flak jacket for her safety</fex>.
<fex>The report</fex> also mentioned contamination problems during the manufacture.
If someone mentions <fex>things like ration books</fex> , my stomach turns.
<fex>AOL 's</fex> agreement with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .
Mozilla Foundation now has a bindingagreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have an agreement <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have an agreement to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The missile agreement <fex>of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.
The <fex>Kyoto</fex> treaty has so far been relatively ineffectual.
<fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
